alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:01PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL TAOS, NORTH CENTRAL MORA AND SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM MDT... At 300 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Black Lake, or 22 miles east of Taos, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Angel Fire, Black Lake, Ocate, Coyote Creek State Park, Vietnam Veterans Memorial State Park, Chacon, Ojo Feliz, Guadalupita and El Turquillo. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 271 and 278. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 3 and 8. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 8 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
